text.p: Leading insurance companies on Tuesday founded an environmental association to better understand how environmental changes and natural catastrophes will affect their business.

The association -- Insurance Industry Initiative for the Environment -- was founded in collaboration with the United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) with 35 senior officials from the insurance industry.
The new association will launch two working groups, one on climate change issues and the other on asset management.
The purpose of these groups is to exchange ideas and cooperate to develop a better understanding of how environmental changes and catastrophes will affect insurance.
"Insurance companies are interested in not paying damages" said UNEP spokeswoman Gertrud Attar.

The meeting was hosted by Swiss Reinsurance Co together with Employers Reinsurance Corp., General Accident, Gerling-Group Globale, NPI of Britain, Storebrand of Norway, and Sumitomo Marine & Fire Insurance Co. Ltd.

The association is a follow-up to the launch of the UNEP statement of environmental commitment by the insurance industry in November 1995, whose signatories pledged to incorporate environmental considerations into their internal and external business activities.
Among the association's goals is to hold annual meetings to promote sustainable development within the insurance industry.
